author: COMSOL
description: The metal-silicon-oxide (MOS) structure is the fundamental building block for many silicon planar devices. Its capacitance measurements provide a wealth of insight into the working principles of such devices. This tutorial constructs a simple 1D model of a MOS capacitor (MOSCAP). Both the low- and high-frequency C-V curves are computed using the transient study approach (the related model moscap_1d_small_signal shows the small-signal approach). Two alternative methods to compute the differential capacitance are demonstrated, using either the gate terminal or the metal contact terminal, respectively.
label: moscap_1d.mph
